title: How to Measure for Weather Stripping

steps.title: Use a tape measure to measure the door jam, window sash or other area where you plan to install weather stripping.
steps.content: Use a tape measure to measure the door jam, window sash or other area where you plan to install weather stripping.

steps.title: Take the measurements from corner to corner and around any areas that you want to place the weather stripping.
steps.content: Take the measurements from corner to corner and around any areas that you want to place the weather stripping. Measure the depth of the crack or crevice, too.

steps.title: Measure the area twice to make sure that you are accurate and write the measurements down for when you shop for weather stripping.
steps.content: Measure the area twice to make sure that you are accurate and write the measurements down for when you shop for weather stripping.

steps.title: Visit your local home improvement store to purchase weather stripping.
steps.content: Visit your local home improvement store to purchase weather stripping. Determine which type of weather stripping will work best for your specific needs.

steps.title: Weather stripping is made in a variety of materials including vinyl, plastic, rubber and aluminum.
steps.content: Weather stripping is made in a variety of materials including vinyl, plastic, rubber and aluminum. It comes in strips, sheets and tubing. The best type to use depends on the location, the condition of the window or door and the size of the crack or crevice.

steps.title: Choose the weather stripping for your project in a kit or by measured increments.
steps.content: Choose the weather stripping for your project in a kit or by measured increments.

steps.title: Purchase sections that are longer than necessary so you have plenty if you need to trim it.
steps.content: Purchase sections that are longer than necessary so you have plenty if you need to trim it.

steps.title: Measure the weather stripping to match the area where you will be installing it.
steps.content: Measure the weather stripping to match the area where you will be installing it. Test the weather stripping to see if it fits in the area around the door or window.

steps.title: Cut the weather stripping using scissors or metal snips to fit once you are positive your measurements are accurate.
steps.content: Cut the weather stripping using scissors or metal snips to fit once you are positive your measurements are accurate.

steps.title: Install it, trimming off any excess pieces of weather stripping if any areas are too long to fit properly.
steps.content: Install it, trimming off any excess pieces of weather stripping if any areas are too long to fit properly.
